step3.description: Your credits never expire. Top up whenever you want.

token.question: What is a token?
token.answer: A token is roughly 4 characters or 0.75 words in English. A typical message uses 200-500 input tokens, and the AI response uses 200-1000 tokens.

expiration.question: Do my credits expire?
expiration.answer: No, your credits never expire. Use them whenever you want.

refund.question: Can I get a refund?
refund.answer: Yes, you can request a refund for unused credits within 14 days of purchase.

markup.question: Why are these prices higher than direct APIs?
markup.answer: We apply a {markup}% margin to cover infrastructure, interface, and support. Despite this, it's up to 10x cheaper than a ChatGPT Plus subscription for moderate use.

mainDifference.question: What's the main difference between iaiaz and ChatGPT Plus?
mainDifference.answer: ChatGPT Plus costs a fixed $20/month whether you use it or not. With iaiaz, you only pay for what you use (starting from a few cents). Plus, iaiaz gives you access to multiple models (Claude, GPT-5, Gemini, Mistral) instead of just one.

cheaper.question: Is iaiaz cheaper than ChatGPT Plus?
cheaper.answer: For moderate use (a few dozen questions per month), iaiaz costs $2-5/month compared to $20 for ChatGPT Plus. You save up to 80% while having access to more models.

whyChoose.question: Why choose iaiaz over an AI subscription?
whyChoose.answer: Three reasons: 1) Real savings for moderate use, 2) Access to multiple AIs (Claude, GPT-5, Gemini, Mistral) instead of just one, 3) No commitment - your credits never expire.

ethics.title: A note on ethical use
ethics.content: AI is a tool for learning, not cheating. Use it to understand concepts, improve your work, and progress faster. Never submit AI-generated text as your own without reworking and understanding it.

cta.title: Ready to boost your studies?
cta.subtitle: Sign up in 30 seconds and get $1 free credit. Plenty to test all the models!
cta.note: No credit card ‚Ä¢ No commitment ‚Ä¢ Credits never expire

adapted.question: Is iaiaz suitable for students?
adapted.answer: Absolutely! iaiaz is perfect for students thanks to its no-subscription model. You only pay for what you use, which is ideal for a variable student budget.

cost.question: How much does typical student usage cost?
cost.answer: With $1 free credit on signup, you can ask about 50 questions to Claude Sonnet or 100+ questions to Mistral. For a month of moderate use (studying, homework help), expect $2-5.

dissertation.question: Can I use AI for my essays?
dissertation.answer: AI is a tool to help you understand, structure, and improve your work - not to cheat. Use it to understand concepts, brainstorm ideas, and improve your style, but always rework the content in your own words.

bestAI.question: Which AI is best for studying?
bestAI.answer: It depends! Claude excels at writing and text analysis. GPT-5 is great for math and code. Gemini handles very long documents. Mistral is economical for simple questions. With iaiaz, you have access to all of them.

pricing.question: How does pricing work for institutions?
pricing.answer: You purchase a credit pool for your institution. These credits are shared among all your students. You only pay for what's actually consumed, with no per-student subscription.

equity.question: Why provide AI to our students?
equity.answer: A ChatGPT subscription costs $20/month - unaffordable for many students. Those who can pay have an advantage over others. By providing equitable access, you correct this inequality and give everyone the same tools to succeed.

visibility.question: Can I see my students' conversations?
visibility.answer: Two options: 1) Statistics only (default) - you see who uses what, when, how much. 2) Conversation access (optional) - can be enabled per class, with students informed upfront. This transparency helps you understand real usage patterns and adapt your teaching.

setup.question: How does the setup process work?
setup.answer: We handle everything: account creation, configuration, teacher training. Setup typically takes 1-2 weeks.

models.question: Which models are available?
models.answer: All iaiaz models: Claude (Anthropic), GPT-5 (OpenAI), Gemini (Google), Mistral. You can restrict access to certain models if desired.

hero.title: Your students already use AI.
hero.titleHighlight: Turn it into a teaching advantage.
hero.subtitle: You can't ban it. You can't ignore it. But you can make it a learning tool ‚Äî with full visibility.

problem.title: The real problem isn't AI
problem.subtitle: It's invisible AI. When a student uses ChatGPT secretly, you lose everything.

fear1.title: "Students will cheat"
fear1.flip: They're already using AI ‚Äî you just can't see it. With iaiaz, you know who uses it, for what, and how.

fear2.title: "AI does the work for them"
fear2.flip: AI reveals what students don't understand. The questions they ask are a pedagogical goldmine.

fear3.title: "I'm losing control"
fear3.flip: You gain visibility you never had before. You see knowledge gaps in real-time.

invisible.title: The invisible AI problem
invisible.description: When a student asks ChatGPT a question, you don't know:
invisible.point1: What they didn't understand from your class
invisible.point2: Whether they rephrased the answer or copy-pasted
invisible.point3: Whether they learned something or just got an answer

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.a1: Students can pay themselves, or you can allocate a budget per class from your account.
faq.q2: Can I see my students' conversations?
faq.a2: By default, you see aggregate statistics (topics, frequency). Access to individual conversations is optional and requires student consent.
faq.a3: $4.90/month per active class. A class is considered active once a student uses the tool.
faq.a4: Yes, setup is free and you can cancel anytime. Start with one class to test.

hero.title: iaiaz vs ChatGPT Plus
hero.subtitle: Why pay $20/month when a few dollars is enough?

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.q1: Is ChatGPT Plus really more expensive?
faq.a1: Yes, ChatGPT Plus costs a fixed $20/month whether you use it 5 times or 500 times. With iaiaz, you only pay for what you use.
faq.a2: iaiaz uses the same models as ChatGPT Plus (GPT-5), plus others like Claude which excels at writing and Gemini for long documents.
faq.q3: What if I use AI a lot?
faq.a3: Even with intensive use (~300 questions/month), you stay around $15, that's 25% savings. And you have access to more models.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.q1: Is ChatGPT Team really 23x more expensive?
faq.a1: Yes, ChatGPT Team costs $25/user/month (~$23). With iaiaz, subscription + credits comes to about $1/student/month for moderate use.
faq.a2: iaiaz offers more models (Claude, GPT-5, Gemini, Mistral), a pedagogical dashboard, and fine budget control. ChatGPT Team only offers GPT-5.
faq.a3: We handle everything: account creation, configuration, teacher training. Setup takes 1-2 weeks.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.a1: On the contrary! By making AI visible, you can supervise its use and see how students use it. Invisible AI (hidden ChatGPT) encourages cheating because it's uncontrollable.
faq.a2: By default: topics discussed, usage frequency, activity peaks. Optional (with consent): individual conversations.
faq.a3: 5 minutes per week is enough. The dashboard generates automatic insights and alerts you to important points.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about iaiaz

cost.question: How much does iaiaz cost?
cost.answer: iaiaz works without a subscription. You buy credits (starting from $1) and pay only for what you use. A simple question costs about $0.01 to $0.02 depending on the model. We offer $1 free credits on signup to try it out.

vsChatgpt.question: What's the difference between iaiaz and ChatGPT Plus?
vsChatgpt.answer: ChatGPT Plus costs $20/month whether you use it or not. With iaiaz, you pay per use: if you use AI 10 times a month, you pay a few cents, not $20. Plus, iaiaz gives you access to multiple models (Claude, GPT-5, Gemini, Mistral) instead of just one.

subscription.question: Do I need a subscription to use iaiaz?
subscription.answer: No, never. That's our core principle: zero commitment, zero subscription. You buy credits when you need them, and they never expire. No automatic renewal, no hidden fees.

models.question: Which AI models are available?
models.answer: iaiaz offers over 15 models: Claude Opus, Claude Sonnet and Claude Haiku (Anthropic), GPT-5, GPT-4o and GPT-4o Mini (OpenAI), Gemini 2.5 Pro and Gemini Flash (Google), Mistral Large, Medium and Small, and Codestral for code.

credits.question: How does the credit system work?
credits.answer: Each message uses credits based on the model used and conversation length. The cost is shown in real-time before sending your message. For example, a simple question with Claude Sonnet costs about $0.015.

privacy.question: Is my data protected?
privacy.answer: Yes. iaiaz is a French company (BAJURIAN SAS) subject to GDPR. Your conversations are stored securely and are never used to train AI models. You can delete your data at any time.

students.question: Can I use iaiaz for my studies?
students.answer: Absolutely! iaiaz is perfect for students: writing help, explaining complex concepts, text correction, coding help, exam preparation... And the no-subscription model is ideal for a student budget.

freeCredits.question: How do I get my free credits?
freeCredits.answer: Simply create an account on iaiaz. Once your email is verified, $1 in credits is automatically added to your account. No credit card required for signup.

expiration.question: Do credits expire?
expiration.answer: No, never. Your credits stay in your account indefinitely. You can buy credits today and use them 6 months later without any problem.

refund.question: Can I get a refund?
refund.answer: Yes. You can request a refund for unused credits at any time. The refund is calculated pro-rata based on remaining balance. Simply contact us by email at admin@iaiaz.com.

recommendations.superficial: These students master AI but engage little. Check their understanding of the subject.
